channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: All the 50 mph signs on the stretch of the A436 from Kilkenny to Seven Springs need cleaning - they are really hard to see and people assume it is a 60 mph limit, 20th April
item.description:
Kilkeney to Seven Springs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Coberley, Cotswold

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Dead street tree Wellington Square/ Wellington Road, 20th April
item.description:
This tree, a willow only planted this winter, appears to be dead. This location is not likely to be a suitable site for a street tree. It is a road. Just because it has bollards across it and enough soil to support grass, does not mean it has the substrate necessary to support a tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10+ large polystyrene blocks dumped and breaking apart, 20th April
item.description:
Each grey block is over 1.5m long. The blocks are mostly in the bottom of the drainage pit, but some are at the top. The blocks have been breaking up into ever smaller chunks and blowing around the development. The tiny grey polystyrene balls (of which the blocks are made) are now dotted around the grassy areas nearby. Removing these large blocks would limit future pollution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Annatto Close, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect speed limit, 19th April
item.description:
All along church Lane, bentham Lane and cirencester road, signs have been erected informing driver of a 10mph limit in a national speed limit which looks official. There are posters regarding horses and passing wide. The signs imply that the speed limit has been changed to 10mph at all times, it is unsightly and rather confusing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The footpath goes down the lane and has done for as long as older residents can remember and is recorded as such. The lane has been blocked by a cattle grid and double gates. Wihtout any public consultation, the landowner moved the public footpath sign and created a new path entrance and fenced off path route, as per pictures. Some of this fence includes low level barbed wire. This 'new' path has in effect diverted the footpath from its legal route.It is impossible for a walker to use the rightful public footpath safely., 19th April
item.description:
At the entrance to Humblebee Cottages, off the Brockhampton Road.

item.title: There are potholes and road deterioration across the whole junction., 19th April
item.description:
The entrance to Meadowhall is covered in potholes and has major road deterioration. This has previously been reported and dismissed by the council. The potholes are getting bigger and the road surface is breaking up even more. It will cause damage to cars and is dangerous for cycles and motorbikes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadoway, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Park Place, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
